title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
Hello,
The Macbook turns on but no  backlight (Confirmed by a torch that the display is on). The board is clean but found a little bit green beside L7701 but no component seems affected or shorted.
Getting 8.5V on the both sides of L7701.

Is it the feedback trace issue that ll require a jumper or is it something else? How can i verify ?

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
Inspect XW7720 bridge.
If needed, fix it.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ujATnRVNYO93ifpZD7KPi6_swX4C38RH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: I dont undertand. Can you please guide me ? What exactly do i check ?

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
Look at the pics.
You can see damaged connection there; figured with red line.
Is your case?

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: The XW7720 point was green. Cleaned that area. Diode Mode Reading to Ground is 0.618 (Red to Ground)

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: Do you have continuity where the red line?

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: Continuity between which 2 points? One is the point marked in red and the other ?

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
There is a red line, not point!
It marks the bridge trace which usually gets corroded.

Look at schematic, to understand what connection to check.

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: There was no continuity . Ran a Jumper Wire. But still the same.

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
You should check the continuity on the other side of the board.
I'm pretty sure the trace inside the board is broken.
One boardview screenshot shows you how to run the wire.
Scratch the trace near the U7701 corner; do not touch its corresponding ball with solder iron.

Just in case, check first if there is continuity.

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message: Did that too but still no light. LCD is good. Checked that

title: Macbook A1466 820-3437 Light Issue
message:
You may need to change U7701 too.
It may have corroded balls..
